titleStmt.title: Saint Petersburg, The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка), Marcel 122

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка) , Saint Petersburg

summary.p: 7 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 122; Qurʾānic Text: Q 51:29-51:36, Q 51:43-52:25; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 185 x 145mm; Script style: kūfī D.I.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
7 fol. 145×185 mm (1.28). Support: parchment, thick but rather transparent, yellowish on the hair side and grayish on the flesh side. Writing material: dark brown ink.
Collation: one incomplete quire, fol. 6 is a singleton with a stub the rest are bifolia.
I: F1H S F2H F3H / H4F H5F H6F H7F
Text layout: 73×145 mm (2.0), 7 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: →D I. Diacritics: absent. Vocalization: round red dots.

Verse markers: for groups of five verses – golden letter ﻪ (hā); for groups of ten verses – medallions in the text line (close to types 2''''.A.I and 2.A.II – fol. 3r), with the inscribed verse number (ثلثون – fol. 1r, خمسون – fol. 3r, ستون – fol. 4v, عشر – fol. 5v, عشرون – fol. 7v).
Title of surah 52 (الطور اربعون وسبع اية) is written in gold on fol. 4v.
Inscriptions: numbers of surahs in Roman numerals and the verse numbers in Arabic numerals are inscribed in brown ink on the upper margin of all pages; numbers of verses are also marked in the text.

Defects: stains on some sheets; upper edges are wrinkled; tear in the middle of fol. 5; margins of all sheets trimmed differently; rear spots of destruction of parchment by aggressive ink on fol. . 3, 4, 5, 7; ink has peeled off on the flesh sides on some spots of certain sheets.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with the letters “C.F.”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink “7 f. – 7 lig. / S. LI v. 30 à 36. et 44 à la fin. /– LII v. 1 à 24” and old accession number “B. 82”; on the verso side the words “Quai des Grands Augustins 27” inscribed in brown ink.
Old accession numbers: CF (on the wrapping), B. 82 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1r–1v. Surah 51, verses 29(29) – 36(36). Incipit: [فأقبلت امر]اته في صرة. Explicit: غير بيت من ا[لمسلمين] .
Fol. 2r–4v. Surah 51, verses 43(43) – 60(60)*. Incipit: [وثمو]د اذ قيل.
Fol. 4v–7v. Surah 52, verses 1(1) – 25(25). Explicit: اقبل بعضهم على [بعض يتساءلون] ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
